text: Alan Baker, FRS (19 August 1939 â€“ 4 February 2018) was an English mathematician. He was known for his work on effective methods in number theory, in particular ideas from transcendental number theory. He was born in London. He worked at the University of Cambridge. In 1970, Baker won the Fields Medal. In 1998 he became a member of the Academia Europaea In 2012 he became a fellow of the American Mathematical Society.List of Fellows of the American Mathematical Society, retrieved 2012-11-03. ==References== Category:1939 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Fields Medalists Category:Academics of the University of Cambridge Category:English mathematicians Category:Members of Academia Europaea
title: Alan Baker (mathematician)
